Freddie McCoy (1932 - 2009) was an American soul jazz vibraphonist. McCoy started out with Johnny "Hammond" Smith in 1961, then released seven albums for Prestige Records and then one in 1971 for the short-lived Cobblestone Records. Before disappearing from jazz.

A striking little set from vibesman Freddie McCoy Ã¢â‚¬â€œ not just for the cool superhero image on the front cover, but also for the tight grooves underneath! The album's one of McCoy's most unified for Prestige Ã¢â‚¬â€œ as all tracks feature a core quartet with Freddie on vibes, Charlie Wilson on piano, Steve Davis on bass, and Rudy Lawless on drums Ã¢â‚¬â€œ not your usual Prestige players, and all musicians who really make the album sparkle! There's a bold soul jazz vibe running through the set Ã¢â‚¬â€œ similar to some of Freddie's other work, but a bit more open too Ã¢â‚¬â€œ and titles include a groovy take on "Girl From Ipanema", plus the soul jazz classics "Speak Out, Deagan!" and "Hav' Mercy" Ã¢â‚¬â€œ as well as the cuts "Yesterdays" and "Spider Man".
This is the second album recorded by McCoy.-
